item.title: Probability in the real world
item.description: Probability 101 Legal problems Health problems Research problems Statistical cognition Probability 101 Types of probability Types. Classic, based on symmetry. Frequentist, based on experience. Subjective, based on best guess. Types of events Independent probabilities. Should multiply. Conditional probabilities. Should use Bayes law. Puzzles Sometimes probability is unintuitive. Birthday puzzle. Legal problems Ignoring dependence Sally Clark had two children dies from SIDS. Dr. Meadow, pediatrician, said there’s 1 in 8543 chance of having a child die from SIDS giving a 1 in 73mil chance of having two children die from it.
